intro: Thalictrum sibiricum, commonly known as Siberian meadow-rue, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Asia. It features delicate, fern-like leaves and produces clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers in early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is cultivated in gardens and natural landscapes.
